nodes.bodyText: It is not only deletion service right? Maybe we split it more or we rename to install state?
Why we need this ? 👀

I had a deeper thinking about that. I think it should be enough to just keep track of the last commit position, which we received. It is not necessary to keep track of the lambdas, which in the end set the commit position.
👍  That would be enough.
In these cases we also would not delete the log stream right?
Yes. It is safe to call closeLogStream in all cases. I will update.
I dont think that this is necessary. Because at some point we will get the next commit position and we also seek to the last committed position, so for me there is no need for that?

There is still a chance for race condition, right? logstream seek to last event, onCommit listner was invoke but ZeebePartition.logstream is null as the start is not completed. Then the commit position is one event behind.  commit position gets updated only if there are more commits. As said in a comment on the other draft PR, this is not a problem on the leader (now) because it doesn't start committing until stream processor is up. But it is possible on followers.
So you expect that we never commit again ? 😅
:D What if there are no more requests?
I did it like this for it to be more safe. But it might not be necessary now as followers never need to know commit position.
I think it is a good idea, but I'm still unsure whether it adds to much complexity which is not really needed. 🤷‍♂️
Btw does it mean that we collect all commits on follower? didn't we go out of mem at some point?
No. Once the logstream is opened, notifications will be cleared.
We can remove this then again
So this means the first writer will create the appender right?
Yes.
this can also be removed
Do we already have a test for creating reader or writer on closed log stream?
We have one in LogStreamTest.
I like the test but please use assertj
does it need to be public available?
Yes. For access in  LogStreamTest#shouldIncreasePositionOnRestart
It seems your IDE orders methods lexicographically.
Don't know why that happens. I don't remember changing any settings. I will verify it.
